intro: Agalmyla beccarii, commonly known as the Bornean starfruit or wild starfruit, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Begoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are edible, though they are not as widely cultivated as the common starfruit (Carambola). Agalmyla beccarii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
